Description: THE MODOC NATION OF OKLAHOMA (THE TRIBE OR MNO) OWNS AND OPERATES THE STABLES CASINO (THE CASINO) ON TRUST LAND IN MIAMI, OK. AS TYPICAL OF A CASINO, THE ENERGY CONSUMPTION IS SIGNIFICANT. THE TRIBE IS INTERESTED IN EXPLORING COMBINED HEAT   POWER TO OFFSET THE ELECTRIC COSTS FOR THE CASINO. TAKING CONTROL OVER ENERGY PRODUCTION AND UTILIZING THE BENEFITS OF CHP WILL ALLOW THE TRIBE TO USE THE SAVINGS FOR OTHER TRIBAL PROJECTS THAT SUPPORT MEMBERSHIP.MNOS FEASIBILITY OF COMBINED HEAT AND POWER FOR THE STABLES CASINO PROJECT WILL STUDY THE VIABILITY OF IMPLEMENTING CHP. THIS PROJECT WILL PROVIDE THE TRIBE WITH THE INFORMATION NEEDED TO PURSUE FUNDING TO DEVELOP A CHP. MNO BELIEVES THE INSTALLATION OF THE CHP WILL LEAD TO INCREASED EFFICIENCY OF THE ENERGY USAGE IN THE CASINO AND RESTAURANT THROUGH ELECTRIC PRODUCTION AND HEATING (AND POSSIBLY COOLING) OF THE FACILITY. THE RESULTS OF THIS STUDY WILL PROVIDE THE TRIBE WITH THE ABILITY TO DECIDE IF IMPLEMENTING CHP WITH NATURAL GAS AS FEEDSTOCK IS ECONOMICALLY FEASIBLE AND A STEP TOWARDS SELF-SUFFICIENCY.THE MODOC NATION WAS AWARDED A 2018 EMPD GRANT IN 2020 TO STUDY THE VIABILITY OF INSTALLING A PHOTOVOLTAIC SYSTEM AT THE CASINO. THE STUDY DEMONSTRATED THAT A SOLAR ELECTRIC SYSTEM HAS POTENTIAL IN NORTHEAST OKLAHOMA. HOWEVER, THE ECONOMIC VIABILITY OF A PHOTOVOLTAIC SYSTEM FOR THE CASINO WAS NOT FAVORABLE DUE TO SIZE LIMITATIONS PLACED ON RENEWABLE ENERGY SYSTEMS BY THE INCUMBENT UTILITY. CHP OFFERS THE ABILITY TO FOLLOW THE ELECTRIC LOAD TO ALLOW THE OFFSETTING OF A SIGNIFICANT AMOUNT OF THE ELECTRIC REQUIREMENTS AS WELL AS TO CONTRIBUTE TO HEATING AND COOLING OF THE CASINO.THIS PROJECT WILL DELIVER THE FOLLOWING: (1) A FINAL REPORT OUTLINING THE POTENTIAL OPTIONS FOR CHP TECHNOLOGIES, HOW IT WILL BE INCORPORATED INTO THE EXISTING INFRASTRUCTURE, THE OPERATIONAL AND ASSESSMENT NEEDS, AND A ROADMAP FOR IMPLEMENT, IF DEEMED FEASIBLE  (2) AN ECONOMIC ANALYSIS OF VARIOUS ALTERNATIVES INCLUDING ALL ASSUMPTIONS MADE  AND (3) A FINAL PRESENTATION TO TRIBAL COUNCIL AND OTHER STAKEHOLDERS.
ENERGY AND MINERAL DEVELOPMENT PROGRAM  EMDP  - 2022

THIS EMDP FUNDING REQUEST IS FOR THE WIND RIVER ENERGY COMMISSION TO HELP THE EASTERN SHOSHONE AND NORTHERN ARAPAHO INDIAN TRIBES TOASSESS FIELDS FOR POTENTIAL ACQUISITION REQUIRING FINANCING ON EXISTING OIL AND GAS FIELDS WITHIN AREAS OF HIGH INTEREST FOR THE TRIBE. THIS EMDPINVESTMENT WILL PROVIDE FOR INCREASED OIL AND NATURAL GAS DEVELOPMENT TO THE TRIBES.BASED ON A PRELIMINARY SCREENING STUDY COMPLETED BY MI3 PETROLEUM ENGINEERING IN THE TENSLEEP RESERVOIR AND THE PHOSPHORIAFORMATION, IT WAS DETERMINED THAT STEAMBOAT BUTTE FIELD AND SURROUNDING AREAS HAVE THE REQUIRED ATTRIBUTES TO BECOME SUCCESSFUL CO2ENHANCED OIL RECOVERY (EOR) AND CARBON CAPTURE AND SEQUESTRATION (CCS) CANDIDATES.FUNDS RECEIVED FROM THIS GRANT WOULD BE USED TO BUILD A DETAILED FULL-FIELD RESERVOIR MODEL THAT WILL BE USED FOR PLANNING, DESIGN, ANDFORECASTING CO2-EOR AND CCS ACTIVITIES. THIS STUDY WILL ALLOW THE WIND RIVER TRIBES TO COMPLETE A RESOURCE ASSESSMENT STUDY TO ESTABLISHA LONG-TERM PATH FORWARD THAT COULD GENERATE ADDITIONAL INCOME FROM THEIR MATURE ASSET AND HELP THE ENVIRONMENT BY SEQUESTERING CO2, APOTENT GREENHOUSE GAS THAT IS THE RECOGNIZED AS THE PRINCIPAL DRIVER OF CLIMATE CHANGE. THESE FULL-FIELD RESERVOIR MODELS ARE CRITICAL ANDREQUIRED TO SECURE ADDITIONAL FUNDING TO ACQUIRE PROPERTIES AND IMPLEMENT EOR SEQUESTERING PROJECTS. THESE STUDIES WILL ASSIST WREC INBEING CARBON NEUTRAL WITH ENERGY DEVELOPMENT.THE RESULTS OF THE RESOURCE ASSESSMENT STUDY COULD UNLOCK A NEW SOURCE OF SUSTAINABLE INCOME FOR THE TRIBES AND GENERATE JOBS INSIDE ANDOUTSIDE THE RESERVATION. CURRENTLY, THE TRIBES RECEIVE 90 PERCENT OF THEIR INCOME FROM THE PRODUCTION OF THEIR NATURAL RESOURCES.THE LONG-TERM GOALS OF THESE NATIONS ARE NUMEROUS: TO STRIVE FOR ENERGY INDEPENDENCE AND TRIBAL SOVEREIGNTY TO BUILD ENERGY RESILIENCE, RELIABILITY, AND STABILITY TO GENERATE SUSTAINABLE INCOME FOR THE TRIBES TO INCREASE STABLE JOBS FOR TRIBAL MEMBERS, 150 TWO YEAR JOBS, AND 50 PERMANENT TO CREATE EDUCATIONAL OPPORTUNITIES AND UTILIZE TRIBAL RESOURCES TO MAXIMIZE BENEFIT TO THE TRIBE TO MINIMIZE THE TRIBES CARBON FOOTPRINT WITH CARBON NEUTRAL CLEAN ENERGY

THIS EMDP FUNDING REQUEST IS FOR THE WIND RIVER ENERGY COMMISSION TO HELP THE EASTERN SHOSHONE ANDNORTHERN ARAPAHO INDIAN TRIBES ACQUIRE AND PROCESS UP TO 25 SQUARE MILES OF 3-D SEISMIC DATA ACROSS EXISTINGOIL AND GAS FIELDS WITHIN AREAS OF HIGH INTEREST FOR THE TRIBES FOR INCREASED OIL AND NATURAL GAS DEVELOPMENT.THE PROJECT GOAL IS TO HELP THE TRIBES TO HAVE THE TOOLS AND DATA NECESSARY TO IDENTIFY NEW AREAS FOR POTENTIAL OILAND GAS EXPLORATION AND DEVELOPMENT. THIS TECHNOLOGY CAN BE USED TO REFINE NEW DRILLING AND COMPLETIONLOCATIONS, IDENTIFY UNDRAINED OR UNTESTED COMPARTMENTS, AND VISUALIZE THE COMPLEX GEOLOGY OF THE ROCKS DEEPUNDERGROUND. THE SUCCESS OF THIS PROJECT COULD BRING LONG-TERM WELL-PAYING JOBS, RESOURCES, AND REVENUE TO THECOMMUNITY.THE MAIN OBJECTIVES OF THIS PROJECT ARE: ACQUIRE 3-D SEISMIC DATA AND RESOURCE ASSESSMENT FOR AN AREA OF UP TO 25 SQUARE MILES ON EXISTING ANDPOTENTIAL OIL AND GAS PROPERTIES ON THE WIND RIVER INDIAN RESERVATION COMPLETE A DETAILED GEOLOGICAL AND GEOPHYSICAL INTERPRETATION THE 3-D SEISMIC DATA IDENTIFY ANY NEW DRILLING TARGETS AND LOCATE GAS IN UNTAPPED COMPARTMENTS OF EXISTING PRODUCING FIELDS POTENTIALLY EXPAND THE PRODUCTIVE EXTENTS OF EXISTING OIL AND GAS FIELDS REFINE GEOLOGIC UNDERSTANDING IN EXISTING FIELDS TO HELP BETTER CHARACTERIZE OIL AND GAS RESERVES IN PLACE ANDHELP DEVELOP PLANS FOR SUCCESSFUL DEVELOPMENT OF ENHANCED OIL RECOVERY PROGRAMS. ADD CLEAN ENERGY AND NATURAL GAS RESOURCES TO THE RESERVATION

THE UINTAH AND OURAY INDIAN RESERVATION LOCATED IN NORTHEASTERN UTAH HAS IN ITS HISTORY OVER 25,000 WELLS DRILLED TO REVEAL THAT UNDER TRIBAL LANDS LIES SOME OF THE LARGEST AND THICKEST CONTINUOUS NON-SHALE FORMATIONS IN THE CONTINENTAL UNITED STATES PRIME POTENTIAL FOR GREENHOUSE GAS SEQUESTRATION. THE EMDP GRANT WILL EVALUATE THESE RESERVOIRS TO BROADEN UNDERSTANDING OF CURRENT AND FUTURE IMPACTS TO DRAINAGE AND THE POTENTIAL OF GREENHOUSE GAS SEQUESTRATION THROUGH RESERVOIR CHARACTERIZATION. THESE SALINE AQUIFER TARGETS REQUIRE MORE UP-FRONT CAPITAL INCLUDING DRILLING SCIENCE WELLS AND REQUIRE MORE ASSUMPTIONS WHICH REDUCES THE ABILITY TO GENERATE ACCURATE MODELS. ON THE OTHER HAND, SHALE PLAY PERMEABILITIES ARE A CHALLENGE FOR SEQUESTRATION BECAUSE INJECTION RATES WILL BE TOO LOW AND OPERATIONAL INJECTION PRESSURE TOO HIGH, WHICH WILL NEGATIVELY AFFECT THE ECONOMICS. THE FORMATIONS IN THE UINTAH AND OURAY HAVE EXCELLENT AND WELL-KNOWN CHARACTERISTICS THAT MAKE THEM SUPERIOR CANDIDATES FOR GREENHOUSE GAS SEQUESTRATION. TO UNDERSTAND PAST, CURRENT, AND FUTURE AVAILABLE PORE SPACE FOR SEQUESTRATION PURPOSES, IT IS NECESSARY TO PERFORM MODELING, AND OPTIMIZATION ON WELL SPACING AND DRAINAGE AND INTERFERENCE EVALUATION. THROUGH THIS STUDY, THE VIABILITY OF COLLATERAL PROJECTS LIKE GEOTHERMAL POTENTIAL INSIDE THE RESERVATION WILL ALSO BE IDENTIFIED.THE MAIN OBJECTIVES OF THIS PROPOSAL ARE:ESTIMATE TOTAL PORE SPACE AVAILABLE PER FORMATION AND DRAINAGE: ORIGINAL, CURRENT, FUTUREDETERMINE VINTAGE AND CURRENT DRAINAGE AREAS AND VOLUME PER TYPE WELL PER OPERATOR FOR DIFFERENT AREAS WITH DIFFERENT CHARACTERISTICSESTIMATE FUTURE DRAINAGE AREA, DRAINAGE VOLUME, WELL SPACING, PER TYPE WELL PER OPERATOR FOR DIFFERENT AREAS WITH DIFFERENT CHARACTERISTICSIDENTIFY BEST STRATEGIES PER AREA AND OPERATOR TO MAXIMIZE DRAINAGE AND PORE SPACE AVAILABILITY THAT BENEFIT OIL AND GAS OPERATIONS AND GREENHOUSE GAS SEQUESTRATIONDETERMINE GREENHOUSE STORAGE CAPACITY AND RATES FOR A LOW, MOST LIKELY, AND HIGH CASESCREATE A LONG-TERM TECHNICAL AND ECONOMIC PLAN THAT SUPPORTS RETIRING AND TRANSITIONING CURRENT AND FUTURE OIL AND GAS WELLS AND FACILITIES TO SEQUESTRATIONIDENTIFY A PATH FORWARD THAT INCLUDES FUTURE ACTIVITIES TO FACILITATE IMPLEMENTATION OF GREENHOUSE SEQUESTRATION PROJECTSIDENTIFY THE VIABILITY OF COLLATERAL PROJECTS LIKE GEOTHERMAL POTENTIAL INSIDE THE RESERVATION ESTIMATE POTENTIAL JOBS AND ECONOMIC IMPACT ON THE REGIONREPORTS AND DOCUMENTATIONSESTIMATED PORE SPACE AVAILABILITY POTENTIALLY USED FOR GREENHOUSE GAS SEQUESTRATIONIN ADDITION, THIS STUDY WILL ENABLE THE TRIBE TO BE MORE SELF-RELIANT BY UNDERSTANDING THE EFFECTS OF DRAINAGE ON REVENUES AND HOW PURSUING FUTURE (RENEWABLE) PROJECTS WILL IMPROVE ECONOMICS AND AIR QUALITY IN THE UINTA BASIN.

THE KUSKOKWIM CORPORATION (TKC) IS AN ALASKA NATIVE CORPORATION FORMED PURSUANT TO THE ALASKA NATIVE CLAIMS SETTLEMENT ACT AND THE SUBSEQUENT MERGING OF 10 ALASKA NATIVE VILLAGE CORPORATIONS FROM THE MIDDLE KUSKOKWIM REGION IN 1977. TKC IS SUBMITTING A REQUEST FOR  323,000 FOR GRANT FUNDING FROM THE BIA EMDP PROGRAM TO PERFORM A WIND AND SOLAR RESOURCE ASSESSMENT AND FEASIBILITY REPORT FOR UPPER AND LOWER KALSKAG, ALASKA, THAT WILL EVALUATE THE POTENTIAL TO DEVELOP WIND AND SOLAR FOR ELECTRIC GENERATION AND OFFSET THE COST OF IMPORTED DIESEL FUEL THAT IS CURRENTLY GENERATING 100  OF THE POWER IN TWO ALASKA NATIVE COMMUNITIES.  THE DESIGNATED TRIBAL LEAD FOR THE PROJECT IS ANDREA GUSTY, PRESIDENT AND CEO OF THE KUSKOKWIM CORPORATION. UPPER KALSKAG IS LOCATED ON THE NORTH BANK OF THE KUSKOKWIM RIVER, 2 MILES UPRIVER FROM LOWER KALSKAG. UPPER KALSKAG AND LOWER KALSKAG ARE SERVICED BY A SINGLE POWER PLANT THAT IS OWNED BY THE ALASKA VILLAGE ELECTRIC COOPERATIVE, INC. (AVEC). AVEC IS WIDESPREAD THROUGHOUT RURAL ALASKA, SERVING 57 OTHER COMMUNITIES. AVEC GENERATES APPROXIMATELY 843,000 KWH PER YEAR FOR UPPER KALSKAG AND 661,000 KWH PER YEAR FOR LOWER KALSKAG FOR A TOTAL OF NEARLY 1.6 MILLION KWH PER YEAR. COMMERCIAL BARGE LINES DELIVER FUEL AND OTHER SUPPLIES IN THE SUMMER WHEN THE RIVER IS ICE-FREE. IN 2021 THE POWER PLANT USED 109,626 GALLONS OF DIESEL FUEL. FOR THIS APPLICATION, WE WILL USE KALSKAG TO REFER TO BOTH COMMUNITIES.CURRENTLY, THE RESIDENTIAL RATE FOR ELECTRICITY IN KALSKAG IS  0.51 KWH BEFORE STATE SUBSIDIES ARE APPLIED. THIS IS NEARLY FOUR TIMES THE NATIONAL AVERAGE OF  0.137 KWH. PRIOR TO THE RECENT RUSSIAN INVASION OF UKRAINE AND RESULTING ENERGY PRICE SPIKES, DIESEL FUEL AND HEATING OIL COSTS WERE APPROXIMATELY  5.00 PER GALLON. THIS HIGH COST OF ENERGY IN KALSKAG, WHICH IS EXPECTED TO ESCALATE MUCH HIGHER THIS SUMMER, POSES MANY CHALLENGES FOR THE COMMUNITY. AS THE COMMUNITIES ADDRESS THESE CHALLENGES, THEIR FOCUS REMAINS ON PROMOTING THE GENERAL HEALTH, WELFARE, AND PUBLIC SAFETY FOR ALL MEMBERS IN PART THROUGH IMPROVED ENERGY SECURITY AND REDUCED ENERGY COSTS. THE GOAL OF THIS PROPOSED PROJECTWIND AND SOLAR ENERGY RESOURCES ASSESSMENT AND FEASIBILITY STUDY FOR KALSKAG, ALASKAIS TO IDENTIFY OPPORTUNITIES FOR RENEWABLE ENERGY INTEGRATION IN THESE TWO TRIBAL COMMUNITIES TO GENERATE CLEAN, RENEWABLE POWER. BY DIVERSIFYING POWER GENERATION AND MOVING TOWARD RENEWABLE GENERATION, WE SEEK TO REDUCE THE RELIANCE ON COSTLY, IMPORTED DIESEL FUEL. THE RISKS OF RELYING ON DIESEL FUEL AS OUR ONLY MEANS OF ENERGY GENERATION INCLUDE BEING AT THE MERCY OF A VOLATILE AND FLUCTUATING COST OF FUEL, POTENTIAL DISRUPTIONS IN THE SUPPLY AND DELIVERY OF FUEL, HIGH POTENTIAL FOR FUEL SPILLS ON OUR TRIBAL LANDS, AND RELYING ON AN IMPORTED FUEL THAT TAKES MONEY OUT OF OUR COMMUNITIES. TKCS REGIONAL ENERGY GOALS ARE TO:  IDENTIFY WAYS TO REDUCE THE RELIANCE OF OUR COMMUNITIES ON IMPORTED DIESEL FUEL.  DEVELOP AN INDEPENDENT POWER PRODUCER IN THE REGION THAT CAN SELL RENEWABLE ENERGY TO THE LOCAL UTILITY, THUS KEEPING MONEY IN THE REGION AS OPPOSED TO PURCHASING AND IMPORTING DIESEL FUEL FOR POWER GENERATION.  IMPROVE RESILIENCE BY DIVERSIFYING OUR SOURCES OF POWER GENERATION.  REDUCE HEATING COSTS THROUGH ENERGY EFFICIENCY MEASURES AND SUPPORTING ENERGY EFFICIENT BUILDING PRACTICES FOR ALL NEW BUILDINGS. REDUCE OVERALL DIESEL USED IN THE REGION TO REDUCE HARMFUL EMISSIONS AND RISKS OF FUEL SPILLS.

STANDING ROCK SIOUX TRIBE AND THE STANDING ROCK (SAGE) RENEWABLE ENERGY POWER AUTHORITY ARE SEEKING FUNDING THOUGH THE ENERGY AND MINERAL DEVELOPMENT PROGRAM (EMDP) TO COMPLETE THE WORK DESCRIBED IN THE STANDING ROCK SOLAR PV AND MICROGRID FEASIBILITY IN RESERVATION DISTRICT COMMUNITIES PROJECT PROPOSAL. SAGE, A SECTION 17 CORPORATION WHOLLY OWNED BY THE SRST, IS DEDICATED TO LEADING COMMUNITY-DRIVEN PROJECTS, LIKE THE PROJECT DESCRIBED HERE, THAT INCREASE ENERGY INDEPENDENCE AND SELF-DETERMINATION. AS PART OF THIS GRANT OPPORTUNITY, SAGE WILL CONTRACT COMPREHENSIVE SOLAR PHOTOVOLTAIC (PV) FEASIBILITY STUDIES AT THE COMMUNITY DISTRICT BUILDING FOR EACH OF THE EIGHT (8) RESERVATION DISTRICTS, AS WELL AS A MICROGRID FEASIBILITY STUDY FOR THE PORCUPINE RESERVATION DISTRICT. THE OBJECTIVE OF THE STUDIES OUTLINED IN THIS PROPOSAL IS TO IDENTIFY ACTIONABLE, SHOVEL-READY PROJECTS FOR DEPLOYMENT IN THE NEAR TERM IN THE RESERVATION DISTRICTS. SAGE FIRMLY BELIEVES THAT INITIATIVES THAT PROMOTE RENEWABLE ENERGY AND ENHANCE GRID STABILITY WILL WORK TO REDUCE ENERGY BURDENS AND NEGATIVE ENVIRONMENTAL IMPACTS WHILE CREATING LOCAL JOBS AND STIMULATING ECONOMIC ACTIVITY FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE STANDING ROCK SIOUX TRIBE AND ITS MEMBERS.THE STANDING ROCK RESERVATION IS COMPRISED OF EIGHT (8) RESERVATION COMMUNITY DISTRICTS, EACH OF WHICH IS A GOVERNMENTAL UNIT OF THE STANDING ROCK SIOUX TRIBE. THE SOLAR PV FEASIBILITY STUDIES WILL OCCUR FOR EACH OF THE FOLLOWING RESERVATION DISTRICTS: LONG SOLDIER, PORCUPINE, AND CANNONBALL LOCATED IN NORTH DAKOTA AND KENEL, WAKPALA, RUNNING ANTELOPE, BEAR SOLDIER AND ROCK CREEK LOCATED IN SOUTH DAKOTA. FOR THE PORCUPINE RESERVATION DISTRICT, A DISTRICT-WIDE MICROGRID AND SOLAR PV WILL BE JOINTLY STUDIED. IN PHASE 1 OF THE PROPOSAL, THE CONSULTANTS, IN CONJUNCTION WITH THE SAGE SOLAR PROJECT MANAGER, WILL EVALUATE EACH POTENTIAL SITE, COMPLETE A MICROGRID LOAD MODEL, ENGAGE WITH STAKEHOLDERS, CONDUCT A MARKET ANALYSIS, DEVELOP A BUSINESS CASE, AND BUILD A COMPREHENSIVE FINANCIAL MODEL. AT THE CONCLUSION OF PHASE 1, SAGE WILL IDENTIFY THE TOP (3) SITES FOR SOLAR PV THAT WILL BE FURTHER EVALUATED IN PHASE 2 OF THE PROJECT FOR ENGINEERING DESIGN AND FUNDING AND IMPLEMENTATION PLANNING. THE TOP SITES WILL BE SELECTED BASED ON A COMBINATION OF FACTORS INCLUDING, PROJECT ECONOMICS, LIKELIHOOD OF PROJECT SUCCESS, COMPETITIVENESS FOR DEPLOYMENT GRANT APPLICATIONS, COMMUNITY SUPPORT, AND ENVIRONMENTAL IMPACT. PHASE 2 WILL FOCUS ON ENSURING THAT THE TOP THREE SOLAR PV PROJECTS AND MICROGRID PROJECT ARE READY FOR DEPLOYMENT WITHOUT FURTHER STUDY. AS SUCH, THIRTY PERCENT ENGINEERING DESIGN DOCUMENTS WILL BE DEVELOPED FOR UP TO THREE SOLAR PV SITES AND THE MICROGRID PROJECT. THE PROJECT ACTIVITIES WILL CUMULATE TO A FINAL REPORT THAT OUTLINES THE FEASIBILITY, ADVANTAGES, DISADVANTAGES, IMPLEMENTATION OPTIONS, AND CONSIDERATIONS FOR FUTURE DEVELOPMENT. THE FINAL REPORT WILL ALSO CONTAIN A TECHNICAL ROADMAP FOR DEVELOPMENT THAT PROVIDES RECOMMENDATIONS ON WHICH PROJECTS, IF ANY, SAGE SHOULD PURSUE IN THE FUTURE BASED ON FEASIBILITY, COST-EFFECTIVENESS, AND LIKELIHOOD OF PROJECT SUCCESS. WHERE FEASIBLE, SAGE WILL USE THE DELIVERABLES DEVELOPED THROUGH THE FEASIBILITY STUDIES TO DEPLOY SOLAR PV AND MICROGRID PROJECT(S) IN THE RESERVATION DISTRICTS OF THE STANDING ROCK SIOUX RESERVATION IN NORTH AND SOUTH DAKOTA. SAGE IS DEDICATED TO LEADING COMMUNITY-DRIVEN PROJECTS, LIKE THE PROJECT DESCRIBED HERE, THAT INCREASE ENERGY INDEPENDENCE AND SELF-DETERMINATION.

THE SPIRIT LAKE TRIBE SEEKS TO EVALUATE THE FINANCIAL AND TECHNICAL VIABILITY OF INSTALLING A COMBINED HEAT AND POWER (CHP) SYSTEM AT THE SPIRIT LAKE CASINO AND RESORT (SLCR). SLCR IS A SIGNIFICANT CONTRIBUTOR TO THE TRIBAL ECONOMY, AND ACCOUNTS FOR AROUND 30  OF THE TRIBES TOTAL ENERGY CONSUMPTION AND 92  OF THE TRIBES COMMERCIAL ENERGY CONSUMPTION. SLCR IS THE SECOND LARGEST ENERGY LOAD ON THE TRIBE WITH AN ESTIMATED ELECTRIC LOAD OF 27,174 MWH YEAR AND A TOTAL ANNUAL ELECTRICAL SPEND OF  2.6 MILLION. SLCR IS LOCATED ON AN ISLAND AND IS A 194,300 SQUARE FEED MULTI-STORY BUILDING WITH 124 HOTEL ROOMS, TWO 200-SEAT BALLROOMS, EXECUTIVE CONFERENCE CENTER AND MEETING ROOMS, AND AN AUDITORIUM. THE EXTERNAL AMENITIES INCLUDE A FULL SERVICE MARINA, FURNISH LOG CABINS, AND AN RV PARK WITH HOOK UPS. THE 24-HOUR HIGHLY VARIABLE ENERGY USAGE MAKES THE BUILDING A SOLID CANDIDATE FOR CHP WHICH WILL DECREASE ENERGY COSTS AND ENABLE A HIGHER ECONOMIC MULTIPLIER FOR THE RESERVATIONS ECONOMY.

THE RENO-SPARKS INDIAN COLONY (RSIC) SEEKS FUNDING TO STUDY THE FEASIBILITY OF A COMMUNITY-WIDE, ISLAND CAPABLE, MICROGRID THAT COULD PROVIDE A SECURE, RELIABLE, AND RESILIENT POWER SUPPLY TO ITS COMMUNITY MEMBERS AND ENTERPRISES IN HUNGRY VALLEY, NEVADA. RSIC BELIEVES THAT CREATING AN ISLAND CAPABLE MICROGRID WILL ENABLE ENERGY SOVEREIGNTY AND SELF-DETERMINATION AND FACILITATE A SHORT-TERM PATH TO IMPROVING THE ENERGY SERVICES WITHIN THE HUNGRY VALLEY COMMUNITY NORTH OF RENO, NEVADA ON 15,354 ACRES OF TRUST LAND IN EAGLE CANYON.AS PART OF THE RENO-SPARKS INDIAN COLONY HUNGRY VALLEY MICROGRID FEASIBILITY PROJECT, RSIC WOULD LIKE TO INVESTIGATE THE INSTALLATION OF DISTRIBUTED GENERATION SYSTEMS AND CONTROLS FOR AUTONOMOUS OPERATION TO POWER TRIBAL AND COMMUNITY LOADS FOR AN EXTENDED PERIOD THROUGH A MICROGRID. THIS FEASIBILITY STUDY WILL ANALYZE AND MODEL CURRENT ENERGY LOADS, IDENTIFY OPPORTUNITIES FOR DISTRIBUTED ENERGY TECHNOLOGIES TO MEET THE LOADS, AND QUANTIFY THE FINANCIAL SAVINGS AND ENVIRONMENTAL IMPACT OVER TIME. ESTABLISHING A MICROGRID IN HUNGRY VALLEY WILL NOT ONLY INCREASE ENERGY INDEPENDENCE BUT WILL ALSO MITIGATE AGAINST REOCCURRING POWER OUTAGES DUE TO ONLY ONE POWER FEEDER SERVING THE EXISTING ENERGY ISLAND. THE ONE FEEDER POWERING THE COMMUNITY IS NOT ONLY UNRELIABLE DURING SEVERE WEATHER EVENTS, BUT ALSO CONSTRAINS THE COMMUNITYS FUTURE DEVELOPMENT. RSIC BELIEVES THAT DEPLOYING A DISTRIBUTED GENERATION POWERED MICROGRID IN THIS ISOLATED COMMUNITY WILL ALLOW RSIC TO IMPROVE THE HUNGRY VALLEY COMMUNITYS ENERGY RESILIENCE, EXPAND OPPORTUNITIES FOR FUTURE DEVELOPMENT, AND ACHIEVE ENERGY INDEPENDENCE.THE OVERALL OBJECTIVE OF THIS PROPOSED STUDY IS TO DETERMINE HOW BEST TO CONVERT THE EXISTING ELECTRIC INFRASTRUCTURE TO AN ISLAND CAPABLE MICROGRID UTILIZING DISTRIBUTED GENERATION AND ENERGY STORAGE STRATEGIES THAT INCREASE GRID RELIABILITY. TO MEET THIS GOAL, THE PROJECT WILL DELIVER THE FOLLOWING: (1) A COMPREHENSIVE FUNDING PLAN CITING SPECIFIC GRANT OPPORTUNITIES AND INCENTIVES  (2) A PHASED IMPLEMENTATION PLAN CONSIDERING OPPORTUNITIES TO SCALE, EFFICIENCIES, TRIBAL PRIORITIES, AND AVAILABILITY OF GRANT FUNDING AND INCENTIVES  (3) A SOLIDIFIED MICROGRID LOAD MODEL IN HOMER PRO (OR EQUIVALENT SOFTWARE)  (4) 35  ENGINEERING DESIGN DOCUMENTS FOR THE MICROGRID MODEL WHICH WILL ALLOW FOR PURSUIT OF IMPLEMENTATION FUNDING  AND (5) A FINAL REPORT AND PRESENTATION TO TRIBAL LEADERSHIP.

NAMB PUEBLO IS SEEKING FUNDING FROM THE ENERGY AND MINERAL DEVELOPMENT PROGRAM (EMDP) TO CONTRACT A PHASE II SOLAR FEASIBILITY STUDY. NAMB PUEBLO HAS COMPLETED A PHASE I STUDY THAT INVESTIGATED THE FEASIBILITY OF A SOLAR NET-METERING PROJECT ON ITS RESERVATION. THIS INCLUDED CONDUCTING A SITE ANALYSIS, DETERMINING A BUSINESS MODEL, AND INTERFACING WITH THE INCUMBENT UTILITY, JEMEZ MOUNTAIN ELECTRIC COOPERATIVE (JMEC), TO PROPOSE A BUSINESS PLAN TO BUILD A 2 MW SOLAR PLANT ON THE PUEBLO: HALF TO SELL VIA PPA AND HALF TO PROVIDE LOWER COST ENERGY THROUGH AGGREGATED NET METERING TO THE PUEBLO RESIDENTS. THE PUEBLO WOULD LIKE TO CONTINUE STUDYING OUR OPTIONS BY INVESTIGATING THE POTENTIAL FOR ADDING BATTERY STORAGE EITHER AT THE HOUSEHOLD LEVEL ACROSS THE PUEBLO OR AT THE UTILITY SCALE ALONGSIDE THE PROPOSED ENERGY PROJECT, AND TO MOVE FORWARD WITH A FORMAL ENGAGEMENT WITH JMEC FOR THE NET-METERING PROJECT. THIS GRANT WILL ACT AS A PHASE II STUDY, IN WHICH WE WILL WORK WITH JMEC TO FORMALIZE AN AGREEMENT FOR SERVICE, CREATE INTERNAL SYSTEMS AT NAMBE TO ENACT AND SUSTAIN THE PREVIOUSLY CREATED BUSINESS MODEL, INVESTIGATE THE BEST OPTIONS FOR ENERGY STORAGE AT THE HOUSEHOLD AND TRIBAL LEVEL, AND WORK TO SOURCE AND PROCURE SOLAR PANELS AND MANAGE THE PROPOSED SOLAR PROJECT AS IT IS BUILT.

THE OTOE-MISSOURIA TRIBE OF INDIANS IN RED ROCK, OKLAHOMA SEEKS DEMD FUNDING TO CONDUCT A STUDY INTO THE FEASIBILITY OF DEVELOPING SOLAR PHOTOVOLTAIC (SOLAR PV) ENERGY AND COMBINED HEAT AND POWER (CHP). THE TRIBE IS MOTIVATED TO LOWER ENERGY COSTS, REDUCE ITS CARBON FOOTPRINT, AND EXPLORE RENEWABLE ENERGY OPTIONS. THE TRIBE BELIEVES THE SOLAR PV AND CHP (RUN WITH PROPANE) WILL INCREASE ENERGY RESILIENCE AND ALLOW THE TRIBE TO BECOME MORE ENERGY INDEPENDENT, THEREBY ASSERTING TRIBAL SOVEREIGNTY. TAKING CONTROL OF ENERGY PRODUCTION AND UTILIZING THE BENEFITS OF CHP WILL ALLOW THE TRIBE TO USE THE ENERGY SAVINGS FOR OTHER TRIBAL PROJECTS THAT SUPPORT ITS 3,300 TRIBAL MEMBERS. THIS PROJECT ALSO AIMS TO INCREASE ENERGY RELIABILITY FOR OUR ELDER HOUSING DEVELOPMENT TO ENSURE OUR ELDERS ARE PROTECTED IN TIMES OF POWER OUTAGES.THIS PROJECT WILL ASSESS THE FEASIBILITY OF IMPLEMENTING SOLAR PV AND CHP ON OTOE-MISSOURIA TRIBAL LANDS IN OKLAHOMA. THE PROJECT WILL ACHIEVE THESE MAIN TASKS: CONDUCT A SITE VISIT TO COLLECT INFORMATION REGARDING CURRENT ENERGY USAGE AND NEEDS. DEVELOP A PRELIMINARY CONCEPTUAL DESIGN FOR FACILITIES SERVED BY CHP. DEVELOP A PRELIMINARY CONCEPTUAL DESIGN FOR SOLAR PV SYSTEMS. ANALYZE ENERGY REQUIREMENTS OF ELDER HOUSING DEVELOPMENT. IDENTIFY AND ANALYZE CAPABILITIES OF POTENTIAL VENDORS FOR INSTALLATION AND O M OF THE CHP. IDENTIFY AND ANALYZE CAPABILITIES OF POTENTIAL VENDORS FOR INSTALLATION OF A SOLAR ELECTRIC SYSTEM. CONDUCT FINANCIAL AND ENVIRONMENTAL ANALYSES. DRAFT A FINAL REPORT AND PRESENTATION IN POWERPOINT THAT PROVIDES RECOMMENDATIONS FOR SOLAR PV AND CHP AS WELL AS CLEAR ROADMAPS FOR IMPLEMENTING BOTH, IF DEEMED FEASIBLE.THE PROJECT WILL DELIVER A FINAL REPORT THAT OUTLINES THE POTENTIAL OPTIONS FOR SOLAR PV AND CHP TECHNOLOGIES, HOW THEY WILL BE INCORPORATED INTO THE EXISTING INFRASTRUCTURE, THE OPERATIONAL AND ASSESSMENT NEEDS, AND THE FEASIBILITY OF DEVELOPING PV AND CHP. THE PROJECT WILL ALSO DELIVER AN ECONOMIC ANALYSIS OF THE VARIOUS ENERGY ALTERNATIVES AND A FINAL PRESENTATION TO THE OTOE-MISSOURIA TRIBAL COUNCIL AND OTHER TRIBAL STAKEHOLDERS.WE ANTICIPATE THAT THIS PROJECT WILL ALSO PAVE THE WAY FOR CREATING MORE WELL-PAYING GREEN-COLLAR JOBS IN OUR COMMUNITY THAT OUR TRIBAL MEMBERS CAN FILL. WHILE CHP STILL USES FOSSIL-FUELS, IT HAS A REDUCED CARBON FOOTPRINT. AND SOLAR PV WILL ALLOW THE TRIBE TO BEGIN USING RENEWABLE ENERGY RESOURCES THAT MOVE US AWAY FROM FOSSIL FUEL CONSUMPTION, THEREBY REDUCING OUR CARBON FOOTPRINT AND GREENHOUSE PRODUCTION. BY REDUCING OUR CARBON FOOTPRINT AND GREENHOUSE GAS PRODUCTION, WE CAN BETTER CARE FOR OUR LAND, WHICH BETTER ALIGNS OUR ENERGY PRODUCTION AND CONSUMPTION WITH OTOE-MISSOURIA CULTURAL VALUES.

THE OBJECTIVE OF THE PROJECT IS TO IDENTIFY, COMPLETE A FEASIBILITY ASSESSMENT, AND PERFORM PRELIMINARY DEVELOPMENT AND ENGINEERING OF A SOLAR GENERATION FACILITY OR SOLAR   STORAGE MICROGRID THAT COULD POWER GTBS FACILITIES DURING OUTAGES ON THE TRANSMISSION AND DISTRIBUTION SYSTEM. IN ADDITION TO ENHANCED RESILIENCE, THE PROJECT PROVIDES AN OPPORTUNITY TO SPARK ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT, REDUCE THE TRIBES CARBON FOOTPRINT, AND SUPPORT THE TRIBAL COUNCILS DESIRE TO INCREASE GTBS CONTROL OVER ENERGY INFRASTRUCTURE BY REDUCING ITS RELIANCE ON THEIR ELECTRIC UTILITIES.

COOK INLET REGION, INC. (CIRI) IS AN ALASKA NATIVE CORPORATION AND IS CURRENTLY OWNED BY APPROXIMATELY 9,000 ALASKA NATIVE SHAREHOLDERS. CIRI IS REQUESTING  1,024,562.70  OF EMDP GRANT FUNDING FOR TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE FOR THE PROPOSED FAREWELL MINERAL EXPLORATION PROGRAM, PHASE 2. THE PROPOSED PROJECT WILL BUILD ON THE PHASE 1 PRE-DEVELOPMENT STUDY AND EMBARK ON A FULL-SEASON EXPLORATION PROGRAM AND IN-DEPTH EVALUATION OF THE FAREWELL DISTRICTS PRECIOUS, BASE AND CRITICAL METAL RESOURCES.CIRI IS SOUTHCENTRAL ALASKAS LARGEST PRIVATE LANDOWNER, CONTROLLING 1.6 MILLION ACRES OF SUBSURFACE ESTATE LAND IN SOUTHCENTRAL ALASKA AND SURROUNDING AREAS. MINERAL PROPERTIES CONTROLLED BY CIRI INCLUDE THE RED MOUNTAIN CHROME DEPOSIT NEAR SELDOVIA, THE JOHNSON RIVER GOLD-ZINC PROSPECT ON THE WEST SIDE OF COOK INLET, AND THE FAREWELL BASE METAL DISTRICT SOUTHEAST OF MCGRATH. ONE OF THE MOST PROMISING OF THESE PROPERTIES IS FAREWELL, A PROPERTY ABOUT 160 MILES NORTHWEST OF ANCHORAGE WHERE A WIDE VARIETY OF PRECIOUS AND BASE METALS HAVE BEEN IDENTIFIED. FAREWELL IS A VERY LARGE AREA ENCOMPASSING MANY PROSPECTS. BASED ON PHASE 1, IT WAS VERIFIED THAT ABUNDANT ZINC-COPPER-SILVER SKARN AND MANTO MINERALIZATION IN THE FAREWELL TRACT INDICATES A LARGE VOLUME OF MINERALIZED, HYDROTHERMAL FLUID HAS MOVED THROUGH THE UNDERLYING ROCKS.  THE SOURCE OR SOURCES FOR MINERALIZING FLUIDS HAVE YET TO BE DISCOVERED. THE SKARNS AND MANTOS ARE RECOGNIZED AS POSSIBLE INDICATORS OF A BURIED PORPHYRY DEPOSIT. PHASE 2 WILL FOCUS ON THE 6120 AND MIDWAY TARGETS, AS THESE WERE SHOWN TO BE THE MOST PROSPECTIVE FOR COPPER PORPHYRIES. EMDP GRANT FUNDS WOULD BE USED TO ADVANCE FURTHER EXPLORATION, IDENTIFYING DRILLABLE PROSPECTS SO THAT A RESERVE ESTIMATION CAN BE CALCULATED AND SO THE PROJECT CAN BE MARKETED TO MINING COMPANIES.

THE MORONGO BAND OF MISSION INDIANS SEEKS FUNDING THROUGH THIS EMDP GRANT TO INSTALL A SERIES OF SOLAR CARPORTS ON FOUR EXISTING PARKING LOTS TO OFFSET THE ELECTRICITY USAGE OF THE ADJACENT FACILITIES. IN RECENT YEARS, TRIBAL MEMBERS HAVE SEEN THEIR UTILITY BILLS INCREASE DUE TO RATE HIKES FROM THE ELECTRIC UTILITY THAT SERVES THE RESERVATION. AS A RESULT, THE TRIBE IS INVESTIGATING OPTIONS TO LOWER ITS UTILITY BILLS, INCLUDING THROUGH THE DEVELOPMENT OF ENERGY-GENERATING RESOURCES SUCH AS PHOTOVOLTAIC SOLAR WHICH HAS PROVED TO BECOME AN INEXPENSIVE SOURCE OF CLEAN, RENEWABLE ENERGY OVER THE PAST DECADE. THE SOLAR CARPORTS ARE INTENDED TO OFFSET THE ENERGY USAGE OF FOUR OF THE TRIBES MOST ENERGY-CONSUMING FACILITIES AND HAVE THE ADDITIONAL BENEFIT OF PROVIDING SHADE TO THE VEHICLES PARKED UNDERNEATH THEM.ENERGY IS A KEY DRIVER IN BUSINESS DEVELOPMENT AND A NON-TRIVIAL UTILITY EXPENSE FOR THE TRIBE AND ITS MEMBERS. THE CURRENT PANDEMIC HAS DEMONSTRATED THE IMPORTANCE OF RESILIENCE AND THE RESULTING FALLOUTS, FROM SUPPLY CHAIN ISSUES TO SHORTFALLS IN MEDICAL SUPPLIES AND ACCESS. INCREASED SELF-RELIANCE WITH RESPECT TO ENERGY IS A KEY FACTOR IN BUILDING RESILIENCE FOR THE TRIBE.THE ACTIVITIES PROPOSED UNDER THIS GRANT INCLUDE ANALYZING THE CURRENT USAGE OF THE FOUR FACILITIES IN SCOPE, REVIEWING THE RATE STRUCTURE AND POLICIES OF THE ELECTRIC UTILITY SERVING THE RESERVATION, PREPARING PRICING MODELS THAT ESTIMATE THE COST OF THE SYSTEMS IN SCOPE, REVIEWING TRIBAL POLICIES TO DETERMINE THE REQUIREMENTS THE TRIBE HAS FOR AN RFP, ISSUING AN RFP THAT INCORPORATES THE FINDINGS FROM THE PREVIOUS PROJECT TASKS, AND MONITORING GRANT DATABASES FOR ANY GRANTS OR LOW-INTEREST LOAN PROGRAMS THAT THE TRIBE MAY USE FOR THIS PROJECT.

MENTASTA TRADITIONAL COUNCIL IS SEEKING FUNDING TO INVESTIGATE THE FEASIBILITY OF DEVELOPING HYDROPOWER UPON ITS TRIBAL LAND. THE VILLAGE HAS AN ENERGY PRICE WHICH IS 3X THE NATIONAL AVERAGE. THIS CAUSES FINANCIAL STRAIN TO THE VILLAGERS. AS THERE IS AN ABUNDANCE OF FLOWING WATER NEAR THE TRIBE, THE VILLAGE WOULD LIKE TO INVESTIGATE WHETHER AN ALTERNATE ENERGY SOURCE CAN HELP TO REDUCE ENERGY COSTS. WITH THIS GRANT, THE NEARBY FISH CREEK WILL BE INVESTIGATED, WATER FLOW MEASUREMENTS WILL TAKE PLACE, AND BUSINESS ANALYSIS WILL BE DONE TO DETERMINE WHETHER A PROJECT COULD BE BUILT IN A WAY THAT IS ENVIRONMENTALLY FRIENDLY AND AFFORDABLE FOR THE TRIBE IN THE LONG TERM.

THE MEMBERS OF THE IIPAY NATION OF THE SANTA YSABEL RESERVATION ARE PART OF THE KUMEYAAY NATION. THE 15,527 ACRE RESERVATION IS LOCATED IN SAN DIEGO COUNTY, CALIFORNIA ON THE RUGGED AND WOODED SLOPES OF THE VOLCAN MOUNTAINS, AT AN ELEVATION OF 4,500 FEET. THE NATION HAS AN AGRICULTURAL ECONOMY. THE NATION IS PROPOSING FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF  125,000 FOR A RESOURCE ASSESSMENT OF THE SOLAR ELECTRIC GENERATION POTENTIAL OF TRIBAL TRUST LANDS AND A PRELIMINARY ENGINEERING REPORT (SOLAR AND PRELIMINARY ENGINEERING REPORT OR REPORT). THIS EFFORT WILL MAKE THE TRIBE READY TO GO FOR FINANCING AND CONSTRUCTION OF ONE OR MORE SOLAR PROJECT WHEN ADDITIONAL INFRASTRUCTURE FUNDING IS AVAILABLE. THE TRIBAL COUNCIL HAS IDENTIFIED TWO GOALS ASSOCIATED WITH THIS ENERGY AND MINERAL DEVELOPMENT PROGRAM (EMDP) GRANT PROPOSAL, WHICH ARE: (1) ENERGY SELF-SUFFICIENCY  AND (2) LOWERING ENERGY COSTS FOR THE TRIBE AND ITS MEMBERS. THE RESERVATIONS CURRENT ELECTRIC UTILITY IS SAN DIEGO GAS AND ELECTRIC (SDG E). CURRENT (2022) RESIDENTIAL RATES ARE BETWEEN  0.39- 0.49 KWH, WHICH IS EXTREMELY HIGH COMPARED TO THE AVERAGE NATIONAL RATE OF  0.1269 KWH. OFFSETTING ENERGY USE WITH THE AREAS ABUNDANT SOLAR RESOURCE WILL PROVIDE SIGNIFICANT SAVINGS TO THE NATION AND ITS MEMBERS. AS THE RESERVATION IS REMOTE, ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT OPPORTUNITIES ARE NEEDED.

HOOPA VALLEY PUBLIC UTILITIES DISTRICT: A SOLAR ENERGY MICROGRID FOR TRIBAL RESILIENCEEMDP PROJECT ABSTRACTLOCATED IN A REMOTE, HEAVILY TIMBERED REGION OF NORTHERN CALIFORNIA, THE HOOPA VALLEY INDIAN RESERVATION EXPERIENCES FREQUENT AND OFTEN SUSTAINED POWER OUTAGES. THESE OUTAGES DISABLE CRITICAL SERVICES, INTERRUPT DAILY ACTIVITIES, AND IMPACT THE HEALTH AND WELFARE OF VULNERABLE TRIBAL MEMBERS. TEMPERATURES IN HOOPA CAN RANGE FROM 28 TO 114 F OVER THE YEAR  AND OUTAGES FREQUENTLY ACCOMPANY BOTH OF THESE EXTREMES, LIMITING THE TRIBES ABILITY TO KEEP HOMES AND FACILITIES SAFELY HEATED AND COOLED. HOUSEHOLDS LOSE FOOD STORAGE WHICH THEY RELY ON TO SUSTAIN MULTI-GENERATIONAL FAMILIES, MEDICATIONS THAT REQUIRE REFRIGERATION FAIL, AND COMMUNITY MEMBERS WHO DEPEND ON MEDICAL DEVICES WHICH NEED ELECTRICITY TO OPERATE CAN BECOME DANGEROUSLY AT RISK. RESIDENTIAL BROADBAND IS ALSO SIGNIFICANTLY IMPACTED DURING THESE EVENTS, RESTRICTING ACCESS TO TELEMEDICINE AND MORE. FINALLY, THE HOOPA VALLEY PUBLIC UTILITIES DISTRICT (HVPUD) OWNS AND OPERATES THE LARGEST TRIBAL WATER UTILITY IN THE STATE OF CALIFORNIA  AND THESE RECURRING, SUSTAINED OUTAGES CAN MAKE IT NEARLY IMPOSSIBLE FOR THE TRIBE TO PRODUCE SAFE DRINKING WATER. THESE IMPACTS ARE FELT BY ALL RESIDENTS ON THE HOOPA RESERVATION.THE HOOPA VALLEY TRIBE SEEKS TO DEVELOP A SOLAR-BASED MICROGRID TO ADDRESS THESE ONGOING ELECTRICITY RELIABILITY ISSUES AND IMPROVE RESILIENCE IN THE HOOPA VALLEY. USING A TWO-STAGE ASSESSMENT, PLANNING, AND DESIGN PROCESS, THE TRIBE AND ITS PARTNERS WILL FIRST EVALUATE FIVE POTENTIAL MICROGRID LOCATIONS. FOUR OF THESE ARE CRITICAL RESILIENCE HUBS WHICH HAVE BEEN IDENTIFIED BY THE TRIBAL COUNCIL, WHICH COULD BE SERVED BY BEHIND-THE-METER MICROGRID SYSTEMS. THE FIFTH MICROGRID WOULD BE LOCATED AT PACIFIC GAS   ELECTRICS TRANSMISSION SUBSTATION IN HOOPA, AND WOULD PROVIDE RESILIENCE ACROSS THE RESERVATION. THIS MICROGRID WOULD BE A FRONT-OF-THE-METER SYSTEM, SIMILAR TO THE ONE RECENTLY LAUNCHED AT THE REDWOOD COAST AIRPORT.A COMPARISON ANALYSIS WILL CONSIDER THE TECHNICAL FEASIBILITY, FUNDING AND ECONOMICS, LAND AVAILABILITY, REGULATORY CONSIDERATIONS, AND OPERATIONS AND MAINTENANCE NEEDS BETWEEN THESE FIVE SITES. THE TRIBE WILL THEN SELECT THEIR PREFERRED MICROGRID DEVELOPMENT OPTION, AND A 30  ENGINEERING DESIGN WILL BE GENERATED, ENABLING THE TRIBE TO SEEK FUNDING FOR FINAL DEVELOPMENT AND INSTALLATION.THE HOOPA VALLEY TRIBE WILL BE SUPPORTED ON THIS PROJECT BY THE SCHATZ ENERGY RESEARCH CENTER AT CAL POLY HUMBOLDT AND THE NATIVE ENERGY RESOURCES COUNSEL, LLC. TOGETHER, THESE PARTNERS BRING CONSIDERABLE TECHNICAL AND POLICY EXPERTISE IN MICROGRID DESIGN, DEVELOPMENT, AND IMPLEMENTATION, AND IN TRIBAL SOVEREIGNTY AND JURISDICTION OVER LAND USE AND ENERGY DEVELOPMENTS. THE SCHATZ CENTER RECENTLY BROUGHT CALIFORNIAS FIRST COMMUNITY-LEVEL MICROGRID ONLINE AT THE REDWOOD COAST AIRPORT, AND DEVELOPED THE TECHNICAL GUIDE FOR PACIFIC GAS   ELECTRICS COMMUNITY MICROGRID ENABLEMENT PROGRAM. THE CENTERS MICROGRID TEAM ALSO DEVELOPED AND CONTINUES TO PARTNER WITH THE BLUE LAKE RANCHERIA ON ITS OWN GROUNDBREAKING SOLAR-BASED MICROGRIDS, AND WORKS CLOSELY WITH OTHER TRIBES ON CALIFORNIAS NORTH COAST TO SUPPORT THEIR RESILIENCY, SOVEREIGNTY, AND CLEAN ENERGY GOALS.

THE GOAL OF THIS APPLICATION IS TO ASSIST THE FORT PECK ASSINIBOINE   SIOUX TRIBES IN UNDERSTANDING AND DEVELOPING THEIR OWN MINERAL RESOURCES. THE ROYALTIES TYPICALLY PAID TO A MINERAL OWNER ARE A SMALL FRACTION OF THE TOTAL RESOURCE VALUE. THE TRIBES DESIRE TO REALIZE THE FULL VALUE OF THEIR RESOURCES. APPROXIMATELY 1,600 WELLS HAVE BEEN DRILLED ON THE RESERVATION THAT HAVE DISCOVERED OIL AND GAS AND HAVE DELINEATED FIELD BOUNDARIES. MANY WERE DRY HOLES. THEY PROVIDE A WEALTH OF RESOURCE INFORMATION. MANY 3D SEISMIC SURVEYS HAVE BEEN SHOT. THIS INFORMATION HAS THE POTENTIAL TO DE-RISK REMAINING DEVELOPMENT OPPORTUNITIES ON THE RESERVATION.THERE IS SIGNIFICANT RISK ASSOCIATED WITH RESOURCE DEVELOPMENT. THE TRIBES DESIRE TO REDUCE THIS RISK BEFORE INVESTING IN THEIR OWN DEVELOPMENT PROGRAM. INDUSTRY EXPERTS ACKNOWLEDGE THE SUREST PLACE TO LOOK FOR OIL AND GAS RESOURCES IS WHERE THEY HAVE ALREADY BEEN DISCOVERED. DEVELOPMENT RISK CAN BE GREATLY REDUCED BY STUDYING KNOWN PRODUCTIVE AREAS USING MORE AND BETTER DATA WITH A MULTI-DISCIPLINARY INTEGRATED APPROACH. BY INTEGRATING STATE OF THE ART GEOPHYSICAL RE-PROCESSING AND ANALYSIS JOINED WITH GEOLOGIC, PETROPHYSICAL AND ENGINEERING ANALYSIS, THE TRIBES CAN OBTAIN A DETAILED UNDERSTANDING OF PETROLEUM RESERVOIR STRUCTURE, BEHAVIOR AND DRAINAGE. THIS WILL ENABLE THE TRIBES TO IDENTIFY SPECIFIC HIGH CONFIDENCE INFILL OR STRUCTURAL OPPORTUNITIES REMAINING IN A GIVEN FIELD. THE TRIBES INITIATED THIS PROCESS IN 2019 BY COMMISSIONING A STUDY USING A DEMD GRANT IN THE LUSTRE AND BENRUD FIELDS. THE STUDY IDENTIFIED MULTIPLE LOW RISK DEVELOPMENT OPPORTUNITIES IN THE LUSTRE FIELD WITH A NET PRESENT VALUE IN EXCESS OF 168 MILLION DOLLARS AT CURRENT PRICES. THE STUDY ALSO IDENTIFIED ADDITIONAL OIL RECOVERY IS POSSIBLE IN THE BENRUD FIELD BY CHANGING THE INJECTION SCENARIO. THE INFORMATION OBTAINED THROUGH THE PROJECT WAS ALSO INSTRUMENTAL IN HELPING THE TRIBES REACH A DECISION TO ACQUIRE THE ASSETS OF ANADARKO MINERALS INC. TO INCREASE ITS POSITION IN THE LUSTRE FIELD. SINCE THE ACQUISITION THE TRIBES HAVE INCREASED THEIR PRODUCTION FROM ROUGHLY 30 BOPD TO   240 BOPD AND ARE MEETING ECONOMIC EXPECTATIONS. THE PRODUCTIVE AREAS PROPOSED IN THIS APPLICATION ARE AN EXTENSION OF THE WORK PROCESS DONE UNDER THE PREVIOUS GRANT AND ADDRESSES THREE ADDITIONAL FIELDS. THIS PROJECT WILL ALSO EVALUATE RESOURCES IN SOME LESS DEVELOPED AREAS AND ATTEMPT TO IDENTIFY AREAS WITH THE POTENTIAL HELIUM DEVELOPMENT.THE PRIMARY ELEMENTS OF THE PROPOSED PROJECT ARE:ACQUIRE SPECIFIC DIGITAL LOG DATA AND 3D SEISMIC DATA CURRENTLY NOT LICENSED TO THE TRIBESREPROCESS, ANALYZE AND INTERPRET NEW LICENSED 3D AND UNANALYZED 3D DATA ALREADY IN THEIR POSSESSION DEVELOP A MORE DETAILED UNDERSTANDING OF REGIONAL STRUCTURAL AND DEPOSITIONAL TRENDS THAT INFLUENCED PETROLEUM MIGRATION PATHWAYS.CALIBRATE PETROPHYSICAL MODELS WITH PRODUCTION, DST AND CORE DATAINTEGRATE PETROPHYSICS, GEOLOGY AND SEISMIC INTERPRETATION TO CREATE HIGH-CONFIDENCE MAPSSTUDY PRODUCTION AND WELL STRUCTURAL LOCATION TO UNDERSTAND DRIVE MECHANISM AND DRAINAGE AREASSTUDY RECOVERY USING VOLUMETRIC AND MATERIAL BALANCE TOOLS TO UNDERSTAND DRAINAGESTUDY COMPLETION PERFORMANCE TO DETERMINE BEST DEVELOPMENT PRACTICESINTEGRATE ALL DISCIPLINES TO IDENTIFY AND DE-RISK REMAINING HIGH CONFIDENCE OPPORTUNITIESPERFORM ECONOMIC ANALYSIS AND CHARACTERIZE RISK, RANK OPPORTUNITIESTHE ANTICIPATED OUTCOMES THAT MAY RESULT IF THE PROJECT IS FUNDED ARE:BETTER UNDERSTANDING OF THE RESOURCES IN ADDITIONAL AREASIDENTIFY UNDEVELOPED STRUCTURES AND UNDER-DEVELOPED AREAS WITH HIGH RESIDUAL OIL SATURATION ADD TO THE TRIBAL PORTFOLIO OF SPECIFIC DRILLING TARGETS, RANKED BY THEIR ECONOMIC VALUE AND RISKIDENTIFY SPECIFIC ACQUISITION TARGETS TO ENHANCE THE TRIBAL BUSINESS PLAN TOTAL FUNDING REQUESTED FOR THIS ONE-YEAR PROJECT IS 2.46 MILLION DOLLARS, OF WHICH APPROXIMATELY 1.81 MILLION DOLLARS ( 73.4 ) IS THE ESTIMATED COST OF 3D S

THIS PROJECT, DISCOVERY OF FORT INDEPENDENCE MINERAL RESOURCES: DETAILED GEOTECHNICAL ASSESSMENT, (PROJECT) WILL DEVELOP A FULL-SCOPE STUDY OF SITES ON THE RESERVATION THAT IS RICH IN MINERAL RESOURCES.  THE FORT INDEPENDENCE INDIAN COMMUNITY (TRIBE) IS A SMALL COMMUNITY OF PAIUTE INDIANS IN OWENS VALLEY, INYO COUNTY, CA. THE TRIBE S NEW BUSINESS VENTURE, GRINDING ROCK AGGREGATES (GRA), A SAND AND GRAVEL COMPANY, IS LOCATED ON THE RESERVATION.  THE TRIBE IS SEEKING FUNDING TO INVESTIGATE THE MINERAL SOURCES ON THE RESERVATION THROUGH A DETAILED GEOTECHNICAL ASSESSMENT STUDY. THE SCOPE OF WORK INVOLVES THE DRILLING OF UP TO 31 HOLES ON THE FORT INDEPENDENCE RESERVATION TO TEST THE QUALITY AND QUANTITY OF SAND AND GRAVEL PRESENT FOR USE AS AGGREGATE.  RESULTS OF THIS ASSESSMENT WILL GUIDE THE TRIBE IN SCALING ITS BUSINESS AND WILL EDUCATE THE TRIBE IN SITE RECOMMENDATIONS FOR CURRENT AND FUTURE DEVELOPMENT. GRA IS AN ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT VENTURE THAT WILL BRING WELL PAYING JOBS AND REVENUE TO THE TRIBAL GOVERNMENT TO IMPROVE COMMUNITY WELL-BEING.

FORT INDEPENDENCE INDIAN COMMUNITY (FIIC) IS A SMALL PAIUTE INDIAN TRIBE (TRIBE) FEDERALLY RECOGNIZED UNDER THE INDIAN REORGANIZATION ACT AND IS A SOVEREIGN NATION. FIIC SEEKS FUNDING TO STUDY THE FEASIBILITY OF A COMMUNITY-WIDE, ISLAND CAPABLE, MICROGRID THAT COULD PROVIDE A SECURE, RELIABLE, AND RESILIENT POWER SUPPLY TO ITS COMMUNITY MEMBERS AND ENTERPRISES ON FIIC TRUST LAND IN EASTERN CALIFORNIA. FIIC BELIEVES THAT CREATING AN ISLAND CAPABLE MICROGRID WILL ENABLE ENERGY SOVEREIGNTY AND SELF-DETERMINATION AND FACILITATE A SHORT-TERM PATH TO IMPROVE ENERGY SERVICES WITHIN THE 500 ACRES OF TRUST LAND IN OWENS VALLEY, CALIFORNIA, RESULTING IN MUCH NEEDED ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT.FORT INDEPENDENCE RESERVATION IS IN OWENS VALLEY, INYO COUNTY, CA. OWENS VALLEY HAS A UNIQUE AND UNFORTUNATE HISTORY IN ITS DEVELOPMENT OF WATER AND POWER DUE TO THE INCUMBENT UTILITYS SUCCESSFUL LOBBYING EFFORTS TO DIVERT RESOURCES FROM THE VALLEY TO THE CITY OF LOS ANGELES, WHICH IS OVER 200 MILES AWAY. FIIC WOULD LIKE TO INVESTIGATE THE INSTALLATION OF DISTRIBUTED GENERATION SYSTEMS AND CONTROLS FOR AUTONOMOUS OPERATION TO POWER TRIBAL, COMMUNITY AND COMMERCIAL LOADS FOR AN EXTENDED PERIOD THROUGH A MICROGRID. THIS FEASIBILITY STUDY WILL ANALYZE AND MODEL CURRENT ENERGY LOADS, IDENTIFY OPPORTUNITIES FOR DISTRIBUTED ENERGY TECHNOLOGIES TO MEET THE LOADS, AND QUANTIFY THE FINANCIAL SAVINGS AND ENVIRONMENTAL IMPACT OVER TIME. ESTABLISHING A MICROGRID IN OWENS VALLEY WILL NOT ONLY INCREASE ENERGY INDEPENDENCE BUT WILL ALSO MITIGATE FREQUENT POWER OUTAGES, WHICH CURRENTLY OCCUR BECAUSE ONLY ONE POWER FEEDER RADIAL EXTENSION SERVES THE EXISTING ENERGY ISLAND. THE ONE FEEDER POWERING THE COMMUNITY IS UNRELIABLE DURING SEVERE WEATHER EVENTS, BUT ALSO CONSTRAINS THE COMMUNITYS FUTURE DEVELOPMENT. FIIC BELIEVES THAT DEPLOYING A DISTRIBUTED GENERATION POWERED MICROGRID IN THIS ISOLATED COMMUNITY WILL ALLOW FIIC TO IMPROVE THE OWENS VALLEY COMMUNITYS ENERGY RESILIENCE, EXPAND OPPORTUNITIES FOR FUTURE DEVELOPMENT, AND ACHIEVE ENERGY INDEPENDENCE.

THE DEDICATED PROJECT LEAD WOULD WORK CLOSELY WITH AVANT ON THE PROJECT WORK AND WOULD COMMUNICATE ALL FINDINGS TO TRIBAL LEADERS.THE OBJECTIVES OF THIS PROJECT ARE TO ASSESS ENERGY USAGE AND COSTS ON RESERVATION, DETERMINE TRANSMISSION AND DISTRIBUTION SYSTEM ADEQUACY FOR ADDITIONAL SOLAR GENERATION, AND CREATE AN ACTIONABLE PROJECT PLAN FOR THE PROPOSED SOLAR GENERATION PROJECT ON THE RESERVATION. THIS WILL BE ACCOMPLISHED BY MOVING FORWARD WITH DEVELOPING A COMMUNITY SOLAR PLAN (CSP) THAT WILL TAKE BEGIN AT A HIGH LEVEL TO ASSESS WHERE THE TRIBES ENERGY NEEDS ARE. OTHER HIGH-LEVEL GOALS OF THE CSP ARE TO IMPROVE MANAGEMENT OF ENERGY COSTS, TAKE CONTROL OF FUTURE INFRASTRUCTURE BUILDOUTS TO IDENTIFY WAYS TO IMPROVE ELECTRIC SERVICE TO TRIBAL MEMBER HOUSEHOLDS. ONCE THE HIGH-LEVEL ASSESSMENT OF NEEDS IS COMPLETE AND TRIBE HAS AN IMPROVED UNDERSTANDING OF THEIR ENERGY SITUATION, THE TRIBE WILL THEN BEGIN TO FOCUS ON SHORT-TERM AND LONG-TERM OPPORTUNITIES IN SOLAR PROJECT DEVELOPMENT.

EKLUTNA INC. SUBMITS THIS APPLICATION FOR  421,005 IN GRANT FUNDING FROM THE BUREAU OF INDIAN AFFAIRS ENERGY AND MINERAL DEVELOPMENT PROGRAM (EMDP) FOR THE EXPLORATION, IDENTIFICATION, AND ANALYSIS OF SAND, GRAVEL AND HARD ROCK RESOURCES ON EKLUTNA INC. LAND. THIS PROJECT WOULD PROVIDE A REPORT WHICH WILL DEFINE POTENTIAL DEVELOPMENT TARGETS FOR THE NEAR FUTURE AND FOR THE NEXT TWENTY YEARS. IN ADDITION TO THE REQUESTED FUNDS WHICH WILL BE USED FOR CONTRACTED WORK, EKLUTNA INC. WILL CONTRIBUTE ALL GRANT ADMINISTRATION AND PROJECT MANAGEMENT.EKLUTNA INC., AN ALASKAN NATIVE CORPORATION FORMED UNDER THE ALASKA NATIVE CLAIMS SETTLEMENT ACT (ANCSA), REPRESENTS MORE THAN 170 ALASKA NATIVE SHAREHOLDERS AND SUCCESSFULLY MANAGES A VARIETY OF INVESTMENTS FOR THEM INCLUDING SAND, GRAVEL, AND ROCK MINING AND SALES. IT PLAYS A VITAL ROLE IN THE ECONOMIC LANDSCAPE OF ALASKA AND MAINTAINS CRITICAL ECONOMIC VALUE FOR ALASKA NATIVE PEOPLE, PARTICULARLY IN THE ANCHORAGE AREA. THE MOTIVATION AND GOAL FOR THIS PROJECT ARE TWOFOLD. EKLUTNA INC. WISHES TO EXPAND ITS BUSINESS AND CONTRIBUTE TO THE RECOVERY OF THE ALASKAN ECONOMY BY SUPPLING THE SAND, GRAVEL, AND ROCK THAT ARE KEY COMPONENTS TO MANY INFRASTRUCTURE PROJECTS. NEW SOURCES OF PRODUCT, IDENTIFIED WITHIN THE PROJECT REPORT, WOULD ALLOW EKLUTNA INC. TO CONTRIBUTE TO THE ECONOMIC RECOVERY OF ALASKA BY MEETING THE SHARPLY ESCALATING DEMAND FOR ITS PRODUCTS IN THE ANCHORAGE AREA AND BEYOND. THIS PROJECT WOULD BUILD ON EKLUTNA INC.S EXISTING AND SUCCESSFUL SAND, GRAVEL, AND ROCK BUSINESS.  THE PROJECT REPORT WILL IDENTIFY AND ANALYZE THE QUANTITY AND QUALITY OF SAND, GRAVEL, AND HARD ROCK RESOURCES ON ELEVEN PARCELS OF LAND, ALLOWING EKLUTNA INC. TO MOVE FORWARD WITH MINING AND PRODUCTION. THIS PROJECT WOULD BE COMPLETE BY OCTOBER 31, 2022. MINING AND PRODUCTION ARE SCHEDULED TO BEGIN AS EARLY AS SPRING OF 2023. SALES OF NEW RESOURCE, IN THE SPRING OF 2024, WILL SUPPORT NEW TRANSPORTATION PROJECTS INCLUDING ROADS, BRIDGES, HARBORS, AND HOUSING AND COMMERCIAL BUILDING SITES.SPECIFICALLY, THE REPORT WOULD PROVIDE INFORMATION REGARDING:  TYPE OF RESOURCES AVAILABLE, QUANTITY OF EXISTING RESOURCES, DIFFICULTY OF ACCESS TO THE RESOURCES, AND DISTANCE TO TRUCKING OR RAILROAD FOR MATERIAL TRANSPORT. FROM THE REPORT, EKLUTNA INC. WOULD BE ABLE TO DETERMINE THE COST PER TON OF THE AVAILABLE RESOURCES, AND IT WOULD USE ITS EXISTING BUSINESS MODEL TO PRIORITIZE PARCELS FOR MINING AND PRODUCTION.EKLUTNA INC. IDENTIFIED POTENTIAL RESOURCES ON ELEVEN AREAS OF ITS LANDS AND ADJOINING LANDS IN TOTAL THAT WOULD BE EVALUATED FOR THIS PROJECT. NINE OF THE PARCELS ARE OWNED BY EKLUTNA INC.  TWO SITES ARE LOCATED ON MILITARY JOINT BASE ELMENDORF-RICHARDSON. UNDER THE NORTH ANCHORAGE LAND AGREEMENT, EKLUTNA, INC. IS ENTITLED TO THESE LANDS IF BASE OPERATIONS CEASE OR THE MILITARY MAY LEASE THE LANDS TO EKLUTNA, INC.IN ORDER TO COMPLETE THE REPORT FOR THIS PROPOSED PROJECT, EKLUTNA INC. WOULD RETAIN THE SERVICES OF NORTHERN GEOTECHNICAL ENGINEERING, INC. TERRA FIRMA TESTING (GEOTECH). TO ACCOMPLISH THE PROJECT PURPOSE, GEOTECH PROPOSES TO CONDUCT A SUBSURFACE EXPLORATION PROGRAM ACROSS THE PORTIONS OF EACH PARCEL WHICH ARE BOTH ACCESSIBLE VIA CONVENTIONAL SUBSURFACE EXPLORATION EQUIPMENT METHODS AND OR HOLD PROMISE OF PROFITABLE DEPOSITS OF EITHER SAND GRAVEL OR SHALLOW BEDROCK (OR BOTH). THE SUBSURFACE EXPLORATION EFFORTS (TEST PIT EXCAVATION, HOLLOW-STEM AUGER BORINGS AND OR BEDROCK CORINGS) WOULD BE TAILORED TO SUIT EACH PARCEL AND THE EXPLORATION OBJECTIVES: SAND, GRAVEL, AND OR ROCK.  FOUR TASKS WOULD BE UNDERTAKEN:  RESEARCH PLANNING, SITE RECONNAISSANCE STAKING, SUBSURFACE EXPLORATION SITE CHARACTERIZATION, GEOTECHNICAL LABORATORY TESTING, AND REPORTING.
SOLAR ELECTRIC GENERATION POTENTIAL ON TRUST LANDS WITH A BUSINESS PLAN AND PRELIMINARY ENGINEERING REPORT

THE COUSHATTA TRIBE OF LOUISIANA (CTLA OR THE TRIBE), A FEDERALLY RECOGNIZED TRIBE, IS COMMITTED TO RESPONSIBLY MANAGING ITS TRIBAL LAND IN WAYS THAT PROMOTE ECONOMIC ENERGY GENERATION AND RESILIENCY WHILE IMPROVING THE QUALITY OF LIFE OF THE COMMUNITY IN AND AROUND THE AREA. THIS COMMITMENT HAS LED THE TRIBE TO PURSUE A 4 MWE COMBINED HEAT AND POWER (CHP) SYSTEM AT COUSHATTA CASINO RESORT (THE CASINO, WHICH INCORPORATES THE GRAND HOTEL AND SEVEN CLANS HOTEL) TO REDUCE THE COST OF POWER, HEATING AND COOLING AT ITS CASINO RESORT.CTLA AIMS TO FIND NEW REVENUE GENERATION OPTIONS UPON ITS LAND AND TO EXPLORE OTHER SUSTAINABLE TECHNOLOGIES AND POLICIES, WHICH WILL IMPROVE THE SOVEREIGNTY AND RESILIENCE OF THE TRIBE, ITS FACILITIES, ENHANCE ECONOMIC DIVERSIFICATION, AND REDUCE GREENHOUSE GAS EMISSIONS ASSOCIATED WITH THE TRIBES COMMERCIAL, CULTURAL AND COMMUNITY ACTIVITIES. WITH THIS GOAL, CTLA IS SEEKING EMDP GRANT FUNDING TO EVALUATE THE TECHNICAL AND FINANCIAL FEASIBILITY OF CONSTRUCTING AND OPERATING AN ON-SITE HYDROGEN PRODUCTION FACILITY SYSTEM AT THE CASINO AND DEVELOP AN INSTALLATION PLAN. A HIGH-PRESSURE NATURAL GAS INTERCONNECTION PIPELINE PASSES DIRECTLY THROUGH THE CTLA CASINO GROUNDS. THIS IS AN IDEAL SOURCE OF FEEDSTOCK FOR A STEAM METHANE REFORMING (SMR) SYSTEM, A HIGHLY EFFICIENT HYDROGEN PRODUCTION TECHNOLOGY.THIS PROPOSED FEASIBILITY STUDY AIMS TO (1) ANALYZE THE TECHNICAL FEASIBILITY AND FINANCIAL PRACTICALITY OF INSTALLING AN SMR PLANT AT THE CASINO, (2) UNDERSTAND HOW BEST TO INTEGRATE SUCH AN SMR SYSTEM WITHIN ITS EXISTING ELECTRICAL INFRASTRUCTURE AND ITS FUTURE, PLANNED ON-SITE CHP SYSTEM, AND (3) IDENTIFY THE POTENTIAL MARKETS FOR HYDROGEN AND THE FISCAL AND OTHER PHYSICAL BENEFITS OF SUCH A SYSTEM TO THE TRIBE, ITS MEMBERS, AND INTERESTED FEDERAL AGENCIES STAKEHOLDERS. THIS STUDY ULTIMATELY WILL PROVIDE THE TRIBE WITH THE INFORMATION NEEDED TO DECIDE ON HYDROGEN PRODUCTION SYSTEM DEPLOYMENT.

BAY MILLS INDIAN COMMUNITY (BMIC) RECEIVED A TEDC GRANT TO EXPLORE THE FEASIBILITY OF DEVELOPING A TRIBAL UTILITY ORGANIZATION IN 2017. THE INFORMATION-GATHERING PHASE OF THIS PREVIOUS TEDC UNCOVERED A STRATEGIC ENERGY OPPORTUNITY AVAILABLE TO THE TRIBE. BMIC OWNS VACANT TRUST LAND IMMEDIATELY ADJACENT TO A SUBSTATION OWNED BY CLOVERLAND ELECTRIC CO-OP, WHICH IS THE INCUMBENT ELECTRIC UTILITY FOR BMIC. THIS SOUTHERN-FACING PARCEL IS LARGE ENOUGH TO ACCOMMODATE A SUBSTANTIAL SOLAR PV PROJECT. GIVEN THE SIZE AND PROXIMITY TO TRANSMISSION AND DISTRIBUTION ASSETS, BMIC BELIEVES THAT EITHER A COMMUNITY-SCALE OR, PREFERABLY, UTILITY-SCALE SOLAR PROJECT COULD BE DEVELOPED THERE, GENERATING SIGNIFICANT DEVELOPMENT AND ENERGY RELATED DOLLARS FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE BMIC. AS A RESULT, THE PRIMARY GOAL OF THIS STUDY IS TO EXPLORE THE POTENTIAL OF UTILIZING TRIBAL RENEWABLE RESOURCES FOR THE PURPOSE OF CREATING SUSTAINABLE AND RENEWABLE ENERGY PRODUCTION FROM TRIBAL TRUST LAND. BMIC AIMS TO PROVIDE SIGNIFICANT ECONOMIC VALUE THROUGH EITHER ENERGY SALES OR PASSIVE INCOME SO THAT THE TRIBE CAN APPLY THIS INCOME TOWARD ENERGY INDEPENDENCE. TO ACHIEVE THESE GOALS, BMIC WILL CONDUCT A DETAILED COMMUNITY UTILITY-SCALE SOLAR FEASIBILITY ASSESSMENT AT A TRIBALLY DESIGNATED SITE TO DETERMINE THE ECONOMIC VIABILITY, REVENUE GENERATION AND FINANCIAL BENEFITS OF THE PROJECT ALONG WITH THE EXPECTED RISKS AND RETURNS. SPECIFICALLY, THIS FEASIBILITY STUDY WILL: (1) QUANTIFY THE SOLAR RESOURCE WITH COMMERCIAL GRADE SYSTEM SOFTWARE TO GENERATE ACTIONABLE CAPACITY FACTOR BASED ON REALISTIC SITE LAYOUT AT COMMUNITY (5 MW) AND UTILITY-SCALE (10 MW) FOR THE IDENTIFIED SITE  (2) RUN A REQUEST FOR INFORMATION (RFI) PROCESS WITH POTENTIAL DEVELOPERS TO UNDERSTAND MARKET INTEREST AND SHORT LIST OF RFP PARTICIPANTS  (3) WORK WITH INCUMBENT UTILITY TO ASSESS AVAILABLE TRANSMISSION CAPACITY OF SUBSTATION AND LINES TO ACCEPT COMMUNITY OR UTILITY-SCALE SOLAR UNDER PURPA OR A WHOLESALE POWER MARKETING PLAY TO LARGE OFF-TAKER OR MICHIGAN MUNICIPALITY  (4) DECIDE WHICH SCALE IS APPROPRIATE FOR THE SITE AND THE TRIBES NEEDS AND DEVELOP ECONOMIC AND FINANCE MODEL FOR ENERGY OUTPUT, BUILD-OUT OF THE POWER PLANT AND GO TO MARKET STRATEGIES  AND (5) IF COMMUNITY-SCALE IS CHOSEN, COMPLETE PRE-CONSTRUCTION ACTIVITIES INCLUDING 35  ELECTRIC SYSTEM DESIGN COMPLETION.THIS PROJECT WILL DELIVER A FINAL REPORT OUTLINING THE POTENTIAL ENERGY PROJECT, TECHNOLOGY OPTIONS, AND FEASIBILITY  ECONOMIC ANALYSIS OF THE POTENTIAL ENERGY PROJECT  SOLAR 35  ENGINEERING DESIGN DOCUMENTS  FINAL FEASIBILITY STUDY WITH DETERMINATIONS  AND A FINAL PRESENTATION FOR THE TRIBAL COUNCIL AND OTHER TRIBAL STAKEHOLDERS.

THE  WIND RESOURCE ASSESSMENT FOR TOGIAK AND TWIN HILLS, ALASKA  PROJECT WILL ASSESS THE VIABILITY OF INSTALLING A WIND TURBINE OR TURBINES IN TOGIAK, ALASKA AND THEREBY ADDING A RENEWABLE POWER SOURCE TO THE MICROGRID THAT SUPPLIES POWER TO THE COMMUNITIES OF TOGIAK AND TWIN HILLS IN THE BRISTOL BAY REGION OF ALASKA.  THIS PROJECT WILL CONFER CONSIDERABLE BENEFITS TO THESE COMMUNITIES WHICH SHARE AN INTERTIE, BUT FULLY RELY ON DIESEL GENSETS TO PRODUCE THE ELECTRICITY NEEDED BY THESE COMMUNITIES (COMBINED POPULATIONS OF APPROXIMATELY 875 PEOPLE).  HISTORICALLY, TOGIAK AND TWIN HILLS HAVE USED 230,000-275,000 GALLONS OF DIESEL FUEL ANNUALLY TO GENERATE POWER, ALL OF WHICH HAS TO TRANSPORTED TO THE COMMUNITIES BY BARGE OR AIRPLANE.  SUCCESSFUL INSTALLATION OF A WIND TURBINE OR TURBINES, THE ULTIMATE GOAL OF THIS WORK , HAS THE POTENTIAL TO MAY OFFSET A SIGNIFICANT QUANTITY OF DIESEL THE VILLAGES CONSUME ANNUALLY, INCREASE THE COMMUNITIES ELECTRICITY RESILIENCE, AND PROVIDE MUCH NEEDED WORKFORCE OPPORTUNITIES.BBNC WILL PARTNER WITH THE ALASKA VILLAGE ELECTRIC COOPERATIVE (AVEC) TO COMPLETE THE GRANT PROPOSAL TASKS WHICH WILL INCLUDE, AMONG OTHER DELIVERABLES, A WIND RESOURCE ASSESSMENT, A DETAILED CURRENT AND FUTURE ENERGY COST ANALYSIS FOR THE COMMUNITIES, A DESIGN AND STUDY AND PRELIMINARY CONSTRUCTION BUDGET, PERMITTING AND ENVIRONMENTAL ANALYSIS, AND AN ECONOMIC AND FINANCIAL ANALYSIS FOR THE CONSTRUCTION, MAINTENANCE AND OPERATIONAL COSTS OF THE CONSTRUCTED TURBINES.  ALL OF THESE DELIVERABLES WILL BE COMBINED INTO A FINAL CONCEPTIONAL DESIGN REPORT. BBNC AND AVEC HAVE LONG BEEN INVOLVED IN EFFORTS TO BRING RENEWABLE POWER TO REMOTE AND ISLANDED RURAL ALASKA COMMUNITIES.  BBNC SUCCESSFULLY LED A DOE, TRIBAL ENERGY PROGRAM WIND STUDY FOR EIGHT BRISTOL BAY COMMUNITIES BETWEEN 2003-2007 AND AVEC HAS OPERATED ELECTRIC UTILITIES IN ALASKA SINCE 1968 AND CURRENTLY HAS 32 WIND TURBINES INSTALLED IN 12 DIFFERENT INSTALLATIONS THAT PROVIDE POWER TO 21 COMMUNITIES.

BAY MILLS INDIAN COMMUNITY (BMIC) RECEIVED A TEDC GRANT IN 2017 TO EXPLORE THE FEASIBILITY OF DEVELOPING A TRIBAL UTILITY ORGANIZATION. THAT PROJECTS INFORMATION-GATHERING PHASE UNCOVERED A STRATEGIC ENERGY OPPORTUNITY. THE TRIBE HAS A PARCEL OF TRUST LAND ON A RIDGE OVERLOOKING THE COMMUNITY THAT FACES NORTHEAST, THE PREVAILING WIND DIRECTION COMING OFF LAKE SUPERIOR. THIS SITE APPEARS TO HAVE POTENTIAL FOR SITING ONE OR TWO COMMUNITY-SCALED WIND TURBINES, WHICH COULD DISPLACE MOST OF THE LOAD IN BMIC, WHILE ALSO CONTRIBUTING TO ENERGY INDEPENDENCE THROUGH A NEW TRIBAL UTILITY AND FOR THE ECONOMIC AND ENVIRONMENTAL BENEFITS OF THE BAY MILLS INDIAN COMMUNITY.THE PRIMARY GOAL OF THIS STUDY IS TO EXPLORE THE POTENTIAL OF UTILIZING TRIBAL RENEWABLE RESOURCES FOR THE PURPOSE OF CREATING SUSTAINABLE AND RENEWABLE ENERGY PRODUCTION FROM TRIBAL TRUST LAND. BMIC AIMS TO DETERMINE IF THE QUALITY AND QUANTITY OF THE WIND RESOURCE ACHIEVES AN ECONOMIC CAPACITY FACTOR THRESHOLD. IF IT DOES, THE TRIBE PLANS TO THEN PURSUE THE NEXT STEPS TO FUND, DESIGN AND CONSTRUCT ONE OR TWO UTILITY-SCALE WIND TURBINES TO OFF-SET EXISTING AND FUTURE LOAD. THIS WILL MOST LIKELY INVOLVE NEGOTIATING AN AGGREGATED NET METERING ARRANGEMENT WITH THE LOCAL DISTRIBUTION COMPANY (CLOVERLAND ELECTRIC COOPERATIVE). TO MEET THESE GOALS, BMIC WILL CONDUCT A DETAILED WIND RESOURCE ASSESSMENT AT A TRIBALLY DESIGNATED SITE TO DETERMINE THE ECONOMIC VIABILITY OF A DISTRIBUTED GENERATION PROJECT WITH A COMMUNITY SCALED WIND TURBINE.SPECIFICALLY, THIS PROJECT WILL: (1) PROCURE AND INSTALL A SINGLE 100-METER METEOROLOGICAL TOWER AT THE PROPOSED SITE  (2) COLLECT DATA FOR NEARLY ONE YEAR AND ANALYZE THE WIND CHARACTERISTICS OF THE SITE  (3) PERFORM LONG TERM CORRELATION OF DATA WITH NEARBY SITES TO CONFIRM RESOURCE  (4) MODEL WIND RESOURCE WITH SEVERAL POTENTIAL TURBINES TO DETERMINE POWER OUTPUT  AND (5) CREATE AN ECONOMIC MODEL WITH SENSITIVITY ANALYSIS TOWARD NET METERED PRICING AND POWER OUTPUT TO PROVIDE ACTIONABLE ADVICE FOR DEVELOPING THE WIND PROJECT. THE DELIVERABLES OF THIS PROJECT WILL INCLUDE A FINAL REPORT OUTLINING THE POTENTIAL ENERGY PROJECT, TECHNOLOGY OPTIONS, AND FEASIBILITY  AN ECONOMIC ANALYSIS OF THE POTENTIAL ENERGY PROJECT  A FINAL FEASIBILITY STUDY WITH THE DETERMINATION ON THE QUALITY OF WIND POTENTIAL  AND A FINAL PRESENTATION SUMMARIZING THE RESULTS OF THE STUDY AND SUGGESTED NEXT STEPS.

COOK INLET REGION, INC. (CIRI) IS AN ALASKA NATIVE CORPORATION FORMED PURSUANT TO THE ALASKA NATIVE CLAIMS SETTLEMENT ACT OF 1971 AND IS CURRENTLY OWNED BY APPROXIMATELY 9,000 ALASKA NATIVE SHAREHOLDERS. CIRI IS REQUESTING  320,950 OF EMDP GRANT FUNDING FOR THE PROPOSED RENEWABLE ENERGY RESOURCE ASSESSMENT ON CIRI LANDS. THE PROPOSED PROJECT WILL IDENTIFY, EVALUATE, AND PRIORITIZE WIND AND SOLAR RESOURCES ON OUR LANDS, INCLUDING ASSESSING THE WIND RESOURCE FOR POTENTIAL EXPANSION OF THE HIGHLY SUCCESSFUL FIRE ISLAND WIND PROJECT. THE FINAL DELIVERABLES OF THIS PROJECT WILL BE AN ENERGY ASSESSMENT FOR EXPANSION OF FIRE ISLAND WIND AND INSTALLED RESOURCE ASSESSMENT DATA COLLECTION EQUIPMENT ON ONE HIGH POTENTIAL WIND SITE AND ONE HIGH POTENTIAL SOLAR SITE.CIRI HAS BEEN OPERATING THE FIRE ISLAND WIND PROJECT SINCE 2012. THIS COMMERCIAL-SCALE WIND PROJECT CONSISTING OF 11 GE XLE 1.6 MW WIND TURBINE GENERATORS HAS PROVEN THAT RENEWABLE ENERGY RESOURCES CAN BE SUCCESSFULLY DEVELOPED ON OUR LANDS. THROUGH A 25-YEAR POWER PURCHASE AGREEMENT (PPA), THIS PROJECT MEETS THE EQUIVALENT POWER NEEDS OF 7,000 HOMES AND HAS ELIMINATED THE CONSUMPTION OF UP TO 5 BILLION CUBIC FEET OF NATURAL GAS DURING ITS 10 YEARS OF OPERATION.IF THE PROPOSED PROJECTS DEMONSTRATE ECONOMIC VIABILITY AND ARE IMPLEMENTED THROUGH CONSTRUCTION AND COMMISSIONING, CIRI WILL HAVE A STABLE 20-TO-30-YEAR REVENUE STREAM AND THE RAILBELT UTILITIES WILL SEE AN INCREASE IN CLIMATE-FRIENDLY ENERGY TECHNOLOGY AND REDUCED DEPENDENCE ON CARBON-BASED FUELS. TO INITIATE THIS DEVELOPMENT PROCESS, THIS PROPOSED PROJECT WILL YIELD ESSENTIAL DATA FOR CIRI TO BEGIN DISCUSSIONS WITH UTILITIES ABOUT THE POTENTIAL PURCHASE OF POWER GENERATED FROM WIND AND OR SOLAR SYSTEMS AND BEGIN QUANTIFYING THE POTENTIAL BUSINESS OPPORTUNITY OF AN EXPANDED INDEPENDENT POWER PRODUCER.

THE WHITE EARTH BAND OF CHIPPEWA INDIANS (THE TRIBE OR WHITE EARTH NATION) IN OGEMA, MINNESOTA SEEKS DEMD FUNDING TO CONDUCT A STUDY INTO THE FEASIBILITY OF DEVELOPING SOLAR PHOTOVOLTAIC (SOLAR PV) ENERGY AND COMBINED HEAT AND POWER (CHP). THE TRIBE IS MOTIVATED TO LOWER ENERGY COSTS, REDUCE ITS CARBON FOOTPRINT, AND EXPLORE RENEWABLE ENERGY OPTIONS. THE TRIBE BELIEVES THE SOLAR PV AND CHP WILL INCREASE ENERGY RESILIENCE AND ALLOW THE TRIBE TO BECOME MORE ENERGY INDEPENDENT, THEREBY ASSERTING TRIBAL SOVEREIGNTY. TAKING CONTROL OF ENERGY PRODUCTION AND UTILIZING THE BENEFITS OF CHP WILL ALLOW THE TRIBE TO USE THE ENERGY SAVINGS FOR OTHER TRIBAL PROJECTS THAT SUPPORT ITS 5,354 ON-RESERVATIONTRIBAL MEMBERS. THIS PROJECT ALSO AIMS TO INCREASE ENERGY RELIABILITY FOR OUR TRIBAL HEALTH CARE FACILITIES AND OUR SHOOTING STAR CASINO.THIS PROJECT WILL ASSESS THE FEASIBILITY OF IMPLEMENTING SOLAR PV AND CHP ON WHITE EARTH NATION TRIBAL LANDS IN MINNESOTA. THE PROJECT WILL ACHIEVE THESE MAIN TASKS: CONDUCT A SITE VISIT TO COLLECT INFORMATION REGARDING CURRENT ENERGY USAGE AND NEEDS. DEVELOP A PRELIMINARY CONCEPTUAL DESIGN FOR FACILITIES SERVED BY CHP. DEVELOP A PRELIMINARY CONCEPTUAL DESIGN FOR SOLAR PV SYSTEMS. ANALYZE ENERGY REQUIREMENTS OF TRIBAL HEALTH CARE FACILITY. IDENTIFY AND ANALYZE CAPABILITIES OF POTENTIAL VENDORS FOR INSTALLATION AND O M OF THE CHP. IDENTIFY AND ANALYZE CAPABILITIES OF POTENTIAL VENDORS FOR INSTALLATION OF A SOLAR ELECTRIC SYSTEM. CONDUCT FINANCIAL AND ENVIRONMENTAL ANALYSES. DRAFT A FINAL REPORT AND VISUAL PRESENTATION THAT PROVIDES RECOMMENDATIONS FOR SOLAR PV AND CHP AS WELL AS CLEAR ROADMAPS FOR IMPLEMENTING BOTH, IF DEEMED FEASIBLE. THE PROJECT WILL DELIVER A FINAL REPORT THAT OUTLINES THE POTENTIAL OPTIONS FOR SOLAR PV AND CHP TECHNOLOGIES, HOW THEY WILL BE INCORPORATED INTO THE EXISTING INFRASTRUCTURE, THE OPERATIONAL AND ASSESSMENT NEEDS, AND THE FEASIBILITY OF DEVELOPING PV AND CHP. THE PROJECT WILL ALSO DELIVER AN ECONOMIC ANALYSIS OF THE VARIOUS ENERGY ALTERNATIVES AND A FINAL PRESENTATION TO THE WHITE EARTH NATION TRIBAL COUNCIL AND OTHER TRIBAL STAKEHOLDERS.WE ANTICIPATE THAT THIS PROJECT WILL ALSO PAVE THE WAY FOR CREATING MORE WELL-PAYING GREEN-COLLAR JOBS IN OUR COMMUNITY THAT OUR TRIBAL MEMBERS CAN FILL. WHILE CHP STILL USES FOSSIL-FUELS, IT HAS A REDUCED CARBON FOOTPRINT. AND SOLAR PV WILL ALLOW THE TRIBE TO BEGIN USING RENEWABLE ENERGY RESOURCES THAT MOVE US AWAY FROM FOSSIL FUEL CONSUMPTION, THEREBY REDUCING OUR CARBON FOOTPRINT AND GREENHOUSE PRODUCTION. BY REDUCING OUR CARBON FOOTPRINT AND GREENHOUSE GAS PRODUCTION, WE CAN BETTER CARE FOR OUR LAND, WHICH BETTER ALIGNS OUR ENERGY PRODUCTION AND CONSUMPTION WITH CHIPPEWA CULTURAL VALUES.
